children.name: to persuade sb that sth is true, right, or good
convince
children.definition: to make someone feel completely sure that something is true or right, especially when theydoubted it before:
examples: thuyết phục, làm cho tin theo
▪ I knew it would be hard to convince my father, because he wanted me to go to university.
convince somebody (that)
thuyết phục ai đó (rằng)
▪ The government is trying to convince the public that it’s getting tough on corruption.
convince somebody of something
thuyết phục ai đó cái gì đó
▪ In the end she convinced the jury of her innocence.

children.name: persuade
children.definition: to make someone believe that something is true or right, especially when theydoubted it before: thuyết phục
examples: persuade somebody (that)
thuyết phục ai đó (rằng)
▪ He eventually managed to persuade me that the documents were genuine.
▪ After this accident, it will be difficult for the government to persuade people that nuclear power stations are safe.
persuade somebody of something
thuyết phục ai đó cái gì đó
▪ We want to persuade them of the value of diplomacy and talks to resolve disputes.

children.name: satisfy
children.definition: to giveenough informationto make someoneinauthoritybelieve that something is true:
examples: thuyết phục ( đưa ra thông tin bằng chứng )
▪ Her explanation failed to satisfy the jury.
satisfy somebody (that)
thuyết phục ai đó (rằng)
▪ Applicants will have to satisfy the committee that they are suitable for the job.
be satisfied with/thataccept something as true
được thuyết phục với/rằng
▪ The police said that they were satisfied with his story and let him go free.

children.name: win over
children.definition: win somebody over  to persuade someoneto supportyour ideas or opinions, by making them believe that you are right, or by being nice to them: lôi kéo ai đó
examples: ▪ He could not be won over by bribes or promises.win somebody over/win over somebody
▪ Cochran’s arguments won over the jury.win sb over to
▪ Doctors who saw her work were quickly won over to her methods.

children.name: bring roundBritish /bring somebody around American
children.definition: bring/talk somebody round   to persuade someone to change their opinion so that they agree with you, especially by spending along timetalking to them and giving themreasonswhy you are right: thuyết phục ai đó đồng ý
examples: ▪ At first my parents didn’t like the idea, but I think I’ve managed to bring them round.
▪ I’ll have to talk my mother round, but I’m sure she’ll say yes.
bring/talk sb round to
thuyết phục ai đó đồng ý với
▪ In the end I brought him around to my point of view.

children.name: convert
children.definition: to change sb’s opinion or beliefs about sth, so that they begin to like it or believe it is right: thay đổi ý kiến
examples: I didn’t use to like Indian food, but Cathy’s converted me.

children.name: convert sb to sth
examples: Concerns about cruel farming methods converted her to vegetarianism.

children.name: win hearts and minds
children.definition: to persuade a lot of people or most people to support what you are doing and believe that it is right - used especially in political contexts: chiếm được cảm tình
examples: ▪ It’s no use giving people short term sweeteners - what we have to do is to go out there and win hearts and minds.
▪ If they succeed in winning the hearts and minds of the ethnic minorities here, they should sweep into power at the next election.

children.name: to persuade sb to do sth
persuade
children.definition: to make someone agree to do something, by giving them reasons why they should do it: thuyết phục
examples: ▪ Neil didn’t want to come at first, but we persuaded him.
persuade somebody to do something
thuyết phục ai đó làm cái gì đó
▪ I tried to persuade his ex-girlfriend to talk to him, but she said no.
▪ Teachers need ways to persuade more parents to attend parent-teacher evenings.
persuade (that)
thuyết phục rằng
▪ He was convicted of the murder, but he is still trying to persuade the public that he’s innocent.

children.name: get sb to do sth
children.definition: to make sb do what you want them to do, especially by trying to persuade them over a long time: thuyết phục ai đó để làm cái gì đó
examples: I’m sure I can get Eddie to do it.
My girlfriend is always trying to get me to stop smoking.
Parents learn ways to talk to and carry a baby to get it to stop crying.

children.name: influence
children.definition: to affect what someone decides to do, but without directly persuading them: ảnh hưởng, chi phối
examples: ▪ I hope you weren’t influenced by anything that your brother said.
▪ Do TV programs influence children’s behaviour?
▪ Judges should not be influenced by political motives.

children.name: encourage
children.definition: to try to persuade someone to do something, because you think it will be good for them: khuyến khích
examples: encourage somebody to do something
khuyến khích ai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ Her parents encouraged her to cook and even paid her to make dinner twice a week.
▪ Patricia encouraged me to apply for the job.
▪ We want to encourage more children to use the library.

children.name: put sb up to
children.definition: put somebody up to  to persuade someone to do somethingwrongorstupid, especially when they would not have thought of doing it themselves:

children.name: xúi dục
examples: ▪ We want to know why they did it and if anyone put them up to it.
▪ Did someone put you up to this?

children.name: persuasion
children.definition: things that you say in order to persuade someone to do something: sựthuyết phục
examples: ▪ They hope to end the conflict using persuasion rather than threats.
persuasion to
sựthuyết phục để
▪ The Republican leader used every means of persuasion to get senators to vote against the bill.
take persuasion
thuyết phục
▪ It took a lot of persuasion to get Dad to agree to the idea.
gentle/friendly persuasionpersuading someone without using threats
thuyết phục êm dịu
▪ Until the law was passed, the agency could only use gentle persuasion to get industries to reduce waste.
powers of persuasionskills used for persuading
kỹ năng thuyết phục
▪ The fate of the bill in Congress will depend on Brady’s powers of persuasion.

children.name: to try hard to persuade sb
put pressure onalsopressureAmerican
children.definition: to keep trying to persuade someone to do something by usingthreatsorunfairinfluence: cưỡng ép
examples: ▪ Threats of dismissal were intended to put pressure on the strikers.
▪ Some of the girls started having sex mainly because their boyfriends were pressuring them.
put pressure on somebody to do something
cưỡng épai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ Her parents put pressure on her and her boyfriend to get married.
pressure somebody to do something
cưỡng épai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ Residents are pressuring the mayor to let them manage their own housing association.

children.name: lean on
children.definition: to usethreatsorinfluenceto persuade someone to do something:
examples: ép buộc
▪ If the US wants to get South American governments to lean on drug growers, it’ll have to be prepared to offer something in return.
lean on somebody to do something
ép buộcai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ New members have been leaning on Senate leaders to make some changes.

children.name: twist sb’s arm
children.definition: twist somebody’s arm informalto persuade someone to do something they have said theydo not wantto do -use this humorously when the person will really enjoy what you have persuaded them to do:

children.name: năn nỉ ai đó
examples: ▪ I’m sure he would never have come if I hadn’t twisted his arm a little.

children.name: ▪ ‘Go on, have another drink.’ ‘Oh well, if you twist my arm.’
to gently persuade sb to do sth
get roundBritish /get aroundAmerican
children.partOfSpeech: [transitive phrasal verb not in progressive or passive]
children.definition: to persuade sb to do sth that you want them to do by being very nice to them, making them laugh etc: thuyết phục
examples: ▪ I managed to get round him by saying he could borrow my car on Saturday.
▪ She can always manage to get around her dad.

children.name: coax
children.definition: to persuade someone to do something that they do not want to do by talking to them gently for a long time until they agree to do it:
examples: dỗ ngọt
▪ ‘Oh come on, Vic,’ she coaxed, ‘We need you, don’t let us down.’
coax somebody to do something
dỗ ngọtai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ The U.S. is trying to coax both sides to take part in talks.
coax somebody into doing something
dỗ ngọtai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ The children had to be coaxed into coming with us.

children.name: sweet-talk
children.definition: to say nice things to someone, especially things that arenot true, in order to persuade them to do something for you:
examples: nịnh bợ
▪ You can sweet-talk me all night long, but I’m not going home with you!
sweet-talk somebody into doing something
nịnh bợ ai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ She sweet-talked him into lending her the money.

children.name: cajole
children.definition: to persuade someone to do something that theydo not wantto do by beingniceto them,praisingthem etc until they agree to do it: phỉnh phờ
examples: ▪ Ed cajoled and pleaded, but couldn’t get her to change her mind.
cajole somebody into doing something
phỉnh phờ ai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ She cajoles the kids into doing their best.
cajole somebody to do something
phỉnh phờ ai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ He managed to cajole Hayden to take part in the program.

children.name: urge
children.definition: to strongly advise someone to do something because you think it is very important:
examples: thúc dục, nài nỉ , thuyết phục[ngoại động từ] ra sức khuyên ai làm gì vì bạn nghĩ điều này rất quan trọng
▪ The company’s bosses are urging full cooperation with the trade union.
Những người quản lý công ty đang thuyết phục sự hợp tác đầy đủ với hiệp hội thương mại.
urge somebody to do something
thúc dục, nài nỉ , thuyết phục ai làm gì
▪ Police are urging drivers not to come into London this weekend.
Cảnh sát đang thúc giục các tài xế đừng đến London vào cuối tuần này.
urge that
thúc dục, nài nỉ , thuyết phục rằng
▪ He gave copies of the report to all those present at the meeting, urging that they read and digest its contents.
Anh ta đã gửi bản copy của bài báo cáo đến tất mọi người có mặt tại cuộc họp, nài nỉ họ đọc và nghiền ngẫm nội dung của nó.
